column4: is there a way to get Gnome to automatically mount an ssh/scp server on session startup? I want to automate the "connected to server..." workflow
yes create a script that does the mount and run the script on startup
the only way I know how to do that is sshfs, which is very buggy. I want Gnome to do the mount. So what would be in a script for that?
how can you mount an ssh server without using sshfs?
in Gnome: places -> connect to server...
no it doesn't. I didn't even have sshfs installed and that works. Gnome does some sort of linking in a directory called .gvfs I think.
this is actually peaking my interest
well FWIW I've had lots of troubles with machine lockups etc. with sshfs and never a problem with mounting through Gnome.
one thing you can do is run: nautilus sftp://<server_name or ip>
it looks like gnome connects over sftp
yes, it connects over sftp
I don't think there is a way to automount an sftp server
you can however set on of the folders on the sftp server as a favorite in gnome this doesn't mount it for terminal use
you mean bookmark it?
yes
yeah I was hoping to have it automount for an automated snapshot/backup program like timevault or flyback. It looks like I'll abandon those for rsync.
rsync is probably the best bet
be careful with the --delete command, I wiped out an entire svn repo with a missing / and --delete once
ok. Thanks for the warning. I wish we had something like Apple's time machine.
try unison its a GTK front end to rsync
its also in the repos
will do. I also found grsync, also a front end.
good luck!
